intro: Ageratina vulcanica, commonly known as the volcanic ageratum, is a flowering plant native to volcanic regions in Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, fluffy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and gray-green, while its flowers range from white to pale blue. Ageratina vulcanica is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
